newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-UBS starts Internet search engines.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-UBS starts Internet search engines.

text.p: UBS Securities analyst Jonathan Cohen started coverage of four Internet search engine companies, with only Lycos Inc winning a buy rating.
-- Yahoo! Inc, Infoseek Corp and Excite Inc were all started with hold ratings.

-- Cohen said he expects Lycos to be the next Internet search and directory company to turn a profit after Yahoo!, which appreciated significantly after posting profits. Said Lycos is moving securely into second place behind Yahoo! in terms of consumer usage, brand awareness, strategic partnerships and financial strength.
-- Shares of Lycos were up 7/16 to 19-13/16 in early trading Monday.
-- Cohen said industry leader Yahoo! merits a more moderate position because of its high valuation levels --- 77.2 times calendar 1996 revenues.

-- He rated Excite a hold, saying advertising revenues and traffic should continue to grow, but noted that the company "seems to be more dependent on external sources of consumer traffic than either Yahoo! or Lycos." Cohen also said that Excite's operating losses are bigger than any of the other three Internet search engine companies rated.

-- said Infoseek has not yet built the level of consumer brand awareness it needs. He said he has a favorable impression of Infoseek's new management and noted that the company has the lowest ratio of market capitalization to expected 1998 revenues of any of the industry group.
-- Infoseek shares were flat at five.
